extra.message: Flags the use of a predictable random value from `scala.util.Random`. This can lead to vulnerabilities when used in security contexts, such as in a CSRF token, password reset token, or any other secret value. To fix this, use java.security.SecureRandom instead.

cwe: CWE-330: Use of Insufficiently Random Values

Internal matching error when running yaml.github-actions.security.curl-eval.curl-eval on /src/.github/workflows/fix-transitive-dependencies.yml:
 An error occurred while invoking the Semgrep engine. Please help us fix this by creating an issue at https://github.com/semgrep/semgrep

rule yaml.github-actions.security.curl-eval.curl-eval: metavariable-pattern failed when parsing $SHELL's content as Bash: summary_file="${GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY:-}"
if [ -z "$summary_file" ]; then
  echo "D[aQyP GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY is not set. Skipping summary generation."
  exit 0
fi

has_vulns="${{ steps.identify.outputs.has_vulns || 'false' }}"
vuln_count="${{ steps.identify.outputs.vuln_count || '0' }}"
changes="${{ steps.check_changes.outputs.changes || 'false' }}"
pr_number="${{ steps.create_pr.outputs['pull-request-number'] || '' }}"
pr_url="${{ steps.create_pr.outputs['pull-request-url'] || '' }}"

{
  echo "## R`US Transitive Dependency Vulnerability Fix"
  echo ""

  if [ "$has_vulns" = "true" ]; then
    echo "### R`TK Results:"
    echo "- **Vulnerabilities Found:** $vuln_count"
    echo "- **Type:** Transitive Dependencies"
    echo ""

    if [ "$changes" = "true" ]; then
      echo "### D]F PR Created!"
      echo ""
      if [ -n "$pr_url" ]; then
        echo "**R`OJ Pull Request:** [#$pr_number]($pr_url)"
        echo ""
      fi
      echo "**What was fixed:**"
      echo "- Added \`<dependencyManagement>\` to Maven pom.xml files"
      echo "- Added \`dependencyOverrides\` to SBT build.sbt (if applicable)"
      echo "- Forces secure versions of transitive dependencies"
    else
      echo "### DEzQyP No Changes Made"
      echo "Vulnerabilities found but no changes were applied."
      echo "This could mean the fixes are already in place."
    fi
  else
    echo "### D]F No Transitive Dependency Vulnerabilities Found!"
  fi

  echo ""
  echo "### R`T[ About Transitive Dependencies:"
  echo "Transitive dependencies are dependencies of your dependencies."
  echo "This workflow uses dependency management to override their versions."
} >> "$summary_file"

Syntax error at line /src/.github/workflows/working-dependency-update.yml:37:
 When parsing a snippet as Bash for metavariable-pattern in rule 'yaml.github-actions.security.curl-eval.curl-eval', `"R`UN Scanning Maven projects for vulnerable third-party libraries..."

# Fix Logback vulnerabilities in pom.xml (your current 6 HIGH alerts)
for pom in $(find . -name "pom.xml" -type f); do
  echo "Processing $pom..."
  
  # Update Logback versions - CVE-2021-42550
  sed -i 's/<logback\.version>1\.2\.[0-9]<\/logback\.version>/<logback.version>1.2.11<\/logback.version>/g' "$pom"
  sed -i 's/<version>1\.2\.[0-9]<\/version>/<version>1.2.11<\/version>/g' "$pom"
  
  # Fix inline Logback dependencies
  sed -i '/<artifactId>logback-classic<\/artifactId>/!b;n;s/<version>1\.2\.[0-9]<\/version>/<version>1.2.11<\/version>/' "$pom"
  sed -i '/<artifactId>logback-core<\/artifactId>/!b;n;s/<version>1\.2\.[0-9]<\/version>/<version>1.2.11<\/version>/' "$pom"
  
  # Update old Akka versions
  sed -i 's/<akka\.version>2\.5\.[0-9]*<\/akka\.version>/<akka.version>2.6.20<\/akka.version>/g' "$pom"
  sed -i 's/<akka\.version>2\.6\.[0-9]<\/akka\.version>/<akka.version>2.6.20<\/akka.version>/g' "$pom"
  
  # Update Akka Management for Pekko issue (your 1 MODERATE alert)
  sed -i 's/<akka-management\.version>2\.13\.[0-9]*<\/akka-management\.version>/<akka-management.version>2.13.5<\/akka-management.version>/g' "$pom"
done

echo "D]F Maven vulnerabilities fixed!"
` was unexpected
